To access your grades and student information and attendance, log in to your portal using your school ID number and password at https://sis-pucu.phinma.edu.ph/iitmsv4eGq0RuNHb0G5WbhLmTKLmTO7YBcJ4RHuXxCNPvuIw=?enc=EGbCGWnlHNJ/WdgJnKH8DA==. Make sure to use your official PHINMA account.
If you forgot your password or can’t access your PHINMA account, visit the ITS Office at CSDL Old Building, 2nd Floor, for assistance. They’ll help you reset your password and get back in.
Students who need get technical assistance may visit the ITS Office near the CSDL old building or find the IT personnel at MacLab or ComLab. The staff can help with technical issues.
If someone is bullying or being mean, you can tell a teacher or the CSDL. Following the Anti-Bullying Policy helps keep everyone safe!
If you feel unwell, go to the School clinic The school nurse is available during class hours to assist with medical needs and first aid.

Here are the programs offered at PHINMA UPang and what each one is about to help you choose the right path: BS Medical Laboratory Science – Focuses on laboratory testing, diagnostics, and medical analysis. Ideal for those who want to work in hospitals or clinical labs. BS Psychology – Studies human behavior, mental processes, and counseling. Great for students interested in mental health, HR, or research. BS Architecture – Centers on designing buildings, spaces, and structures. Perfect for creative and technical thinkers who love design. BS Civil Engineering – Covers construction, infrastructure, bridges, and structural planning. Best for analytical students who enjoy solving real-world problems. BS Computer Science – Focuses on programming, software development, algorithms, and technology solutions. Ideal for tech-savvy, problem-solving students. BS Accountancy – Emphasizes financial management, auditing, taxation, and corporate accounting. Suitable for detail-oriented and analytical learners. BS Accounting Information System – Combines accounting with information technology systems. Good for students who want accounting roles with tech skills. BS Tourism Management – Covers travel operations, hospitality, events management, and tourism services. Great for outgoing students who enjoy working with people. BS Entrepreneurship – Teaches business creation, management, and innovative thinking. Perfect for future business owners and startup-minded students. BS Criminology – For those who want to work in law enforcement, investigation, forensics, and public safety. AB English Language – Focuses on communication, literature, writing, and language studies. Ideal for future educators, writers, or communication professionals.
These descriptions can help you find the program that fits your skills, interests, and future goals.

Your safety is always a top priority. To keep everyone protected, our campus provides clear guidelines on what to do in different emergency situations. We encourage students to stay aware of safety reminders, know their surroundings, and be familiar with exit routes and designated safe areas. By knowing what to do and who to approach, students can feel more confident and prepared whenever unexpected situations happen.

To ensure your safety inside the campus, here are important tips and reminders you should always keep in mind:
• Always know the nearest exits and evacuation routes in your building.
• Report any suspicious people, behavior, or objects to security immediately.
• Keep your belongings secure and avoid leaving bags or valuables unattended.
• During emergencies, stay calm, listen to instructions, and move quickly but safely.
• Know where to find first aid kits, help desks, and school personnel.
• Follow campus rules like ID wearing and restricted-area guidelines for everyone’s protection.
Staying alert and prepared helps keep the entire campus community safe.

Campus life at PHINMA UPang Urdaneta is dynamic and student-focused. The school offers many programs, events, and organizations that help students develop academically and socially. You’re welcome to join clubs, attend seminars, and enjoy different campus activities throughout the year.,
PHINMA UPang Urdaneta provides an engaging campus environment where students can grow and get involved. There are various student organizations, seminars, and campus events available for you to participate in, making your college experience more meaningful and enjoyable.

PHINMA UPang Urdaneta offers a wide range of activities all year round, including academic contests, student festivals, intramurals, organization-led events, and community outreach programs. For updates and schedules, please check the official Facebook page or your department’s group chat.

Our campus hosts many activities throughout the year—from academic competitions and intramurals to club events and community service programs. To stay informed about upcoming events, make sure to follow the school’s official FB page or monitor your department’s GC for announcements.

Interested in joining campus activities? PHINMA UPang Urdaneta has a variety of clubs, sports teams, volunteer groups, and academic organizations. Participating in these helps you develop skills, make new friends, and enrich your college experience.

Looking for ways to get involved on campus? You can join interest-based clubs, sports teams, academic organizations, or volunteer groups at PHINMA UPang. These activities are a great way to learn new skills, connect with peers, and enjoy student life.

Stay updated on campus events at PHINMA UPang Urdaneta by following our official Facebook pages at https://www.facebook.com/share/17r3jW6r8C/, your department’s group chat, and the SIS portal. Announcements about school activities are posted regularly, so keep an eye on these channels.

You can easily keep track of school activities through PHINMA UPang’s official Facebook pages, department groups, and the SIS portal. Regular updates ensure you won’t miss any events or important announcements.

Our school strongly supports environmental protection and community involvement. We encourage students to build eco-friendly habits and participate in activities that help keep the school and community clean and healthy. By working together, whether through simple daily actions or organized programs, we create a greener and more responsible campus environment.

You can help protect the environment and support the community in many simple but meaningful ways:
• Practice proper waste segregation and reduce the use of single-use plastics.
• Participate in school clean-up drives, tree planting, and community projects.
• Keep classrooms, hallways, and common areas clean and litter-free.
• Conserve electricity and water by turning off lights and faucets when not in use.
• Recycle paper, bottles, and other materials whenever possible.
• Encourage others to join environmental activities and promote a cleaner, greener school.
Your small actions can create a big impact on the campus and the community.
Computer labs are for academic use only. Games and unrelated browsing are not allowed.
Always log out after using a unit to protect your account.
Keep the lab clean and avoid eating inside to protect the equipment.
Handle all equipment carefully. Report any damage or malfunction immediately.
Do not install unauthorized software on lab computers.

PHINMA University of Pangasinan started in 1925. Francisco Benitez, Dr. Apolinario de los Santos, Dr. Sylvestre Pascual and Dr. Blas F. Rayos. Upang was acquired by PHINMA in 2009. There are two UPang campuses—one is located in Dagupan (main) and the other is in Urdaneta (branch). The Urdaneta campus — PHINMA UPang College Urdaneta — opened in  April 20, 2015.

Some of the most popular and enjoyable events in our school include:
First Week High – A welcoming celebration where students gather on the first week of classes to enjoy performances, activities, and the famous Kalutan, a community grilling event that welcomes all freshmen.
Lamparaan – A Christmas tradition where students participate in belen making, lampara creation, dance performances that tell the story of Christmas, and the magical Pailaw, where all Christmas lights and the giant Christmas tree are lit up.
School Anniversary – A special event filled with programs, competitions, and school spirit activities to celebrate the institution’s founding.
These events make the school atmosphere vibrant, joyful, and full of memorable experiences every year.

For student services like ID cards, certificates, or clearance forms, visit the Registrar’s Office—they’ll guide you through the process.
For submitting forms, requesting official documents, or clarifying requirements, the Registrar’s Office staff can guide you through each step.

If you have questions about tuition, payment options, or other financial matters, the Finance Office is available to assist you.
PHINMA University of Pangasinan started in 1925. Francisco Benitez, Dr. Apolinario de los Santos, Dr. Sylvestre Pascual and Dr. Blas F. Rayos.
Upang was acquired by PHINMA in 2009.

PHINMA Education aims to make quality tertiary education more accessible. Through the acquisition, UPang was integrated into PHINMA’s network to improve academic programs, operations, and support for students.
The Urdaneta campus — PHINMA UPang College Urdaneta — opened in  April 20, 2015.
Classrooms, laboratories, computer centers, simulation rooms, libraries, and student lounges.
There are two UPang campuses—one is located in Dagupan (main) and the other is in Urdaneta (branch).
The academic head of upang urdaneta is Jessie Ian Paragas Jr.
The Hawak Kamay (HK) Scholarship is a financial aid program at PHINMA UPang for incoming freshmen and transferees.
Open to incoming freshmen and transferees who meet the criteria set by PHINMA UPang.
You can apply by completing the HK Scholarship form online or by visiting the CSDL Office. Submit your requirements and wait for evaluation.
You will be notified by the Admissions or CSDL once your application has been reviewed.
The HK Scholarship does not require a specific grade for renewal, but students must follow the rules and guidelines.
Yes. Violating school policies or failing to comply with scholarship guidelines may result in the scholarship being revoked.
If your scholarship is 25% the duty hours is 30, if it's 50%  40 hours of duty and if it's a 75% the duty hours is 50.

For students applying for the HK Scholarship in the second semester, you only need to submit a handwritten endorsement letter and give it to the Upper Manager in CSDL. Make sure your letter follows the correct format. Endorsements are not an automatic guarantee for scholarship tagging, as all applications still undergo deliberation.
